intro: Helinus scandens, commonly known as the climbing helinus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its twining stems that climb along other vegetation, and its small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Helinus scandens is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
